sendMessage(“You fail.”);

}[/quote]

I’m here to help people and not be an immature prick, so you forgot your " and ".

wow this forum is just a bunch of haters that thinks everyone is a leacher XD, in about every post ive seen someone called a leacher, but nice ring im prolly gunna use

Yeah thanks man I agree, but i’m making another ring now, I just gonna build it in a dungeon and release the full code for it.

item.title: [317] Add a boxing ring to your server
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

Honestly, I do not remember the source of adding a boxing ring to my Boxingscape release. However, if it was from you, Cocoa, then I have probably credited you for that.

Going back on topic and giving you constructive criticism, Tobias, this is but a snippet. I see no effort being put in this what you deem a tutorial. At least attempt to explain what the method makeglobalobject does.

makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType)

Your thread here just shows the makeglobalobject methods being used without explanation.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Add a boxing ring to your server

item.title: [317] Add a boxing ring to your server
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“cocoa, post:13, topic:332823”][quote author=Superd00d link=topic=429250.msg3152689#msg3152689 date=1268696049]

Tbh i don’t give a fuck, I know its not leeched.
I used boxingscape as a reference, to get the IDS,
but look for yourself, the code is different.
You can’t say I leeched the ids because theyre in a 377 cache, I just didn’t know what they were. And this was in my old server.
I was going to add functionality to it and safe pking and a floor, but now I take it back, you can all go to hell you ungrateful bastards.

You know what, RSPS really should be working together and helping each other, not accusing each other of leeching and stuff. From now on, when I do something worth while, I will keep it to myself as everyone else does, although it gets the community nowhere.

Thats so fucking true. All the MoparScape Community ever does it LOOK FOR FLAWS! Everyone criticizes each other. I even left MoparScape for google forums. The community there ACTUALLY APPRECIATES YOU!
[/quote]
Not necassarily, there is a lot of criticism but it leads way to constructive criticism which leads to progress.[/quote]

Hardly any of the criticism on the forums is constructive, its mostly “GTFO NERD, LEECHED, FAIL, lmfao what a leech (do you people even know what leech means?)”
Constructive criticism of this topic would be: “Hey tobias, the idea isn’t original, and this way isn’t very efficient if we want to use it in a construction skill, but thanks for the effort, mabye improve the tutorial and add functionality and explain the code better?”

I’m gonna make a better version of this tutorial. And yes, Project Covic is where i got the idea from (many months ago) but I didn’t leech any code.
This code is not recommended for construction, more for a server feature as Covic has it in lumbridge. I used it in my server and placed the ring on flat ground, and it looked great.

EDIT: Before anyone tries to tell me I leeched off covic, my ring is 6x6, his is 4x4 and im pretty sure its not the same size as the one in boxingscape either.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Add a boxing ring to your server
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

This can be used on any source with the makeglobalobject() method working.

The ring will not have any functionality atm, you will have to add that yourself, and if you can’t, post and I will update.

Basically, this will create a 6x6 (squares) boxing ring for your server using one object.

BTW: You will have to change the coords as shown below… (if you dont want the ring in camelot party room).

makeGlobalObject([b]2734, 3465[/b], 13132, 1, 3);
//Corners south west first)
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3465, 13132, 1, 3);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3465, 13132, 0, 3);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3472, 13132, -1, 3);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3472, 13132, -2, 3);
//West wall, facing east
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3471, 13132, -2, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3470, 13132, -2, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3469, 13132, -2, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3468, 13132, -2, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3467, 13132, -2, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2734, 3466, 13132, -2, 0);
//south wall, facing north
makeGlobalObject(2735, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2736, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2737, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2738, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2739, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2740, 3465, 13132, 1, 0);
//east wall, facing west
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3466, 13132, 0, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3467, 13132, 0, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3468, 13132, 0, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3469, 13132, 0, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3470, 13132, 0, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2741, 3471, 13132, 0, 0);
//north wall, facing south
makeGlobalObject(2740, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2739, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2738, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2737, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2736, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);
makeGlobalObject(2735, 3472, 13132, -1, 0);

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Add a boxing ring to your server
